title: Advowsons Act 1708
text:
The Advowsons Act 1708 (7 Ann c 18) was an <a href="Acts%20of%20Parliament%20in%20the%20United%20Kingdom">Act</a> of the <a href="Parliament%20of%20Great%20Britain">Parliament of Great Britain</a>.
<a href="Advowson">Advowson</a> is the right to nominate someone to a bishop to be appointed as minister to a particular church.
The whole Act was repealed by section 1 of, and Part II of the Schedule to, the <a href="Statute%20Law%20%28Repeals%29%20Act%201969">Statute Law (Repeals) Act 1969</a>.
